channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: マイクロソフト、「シグナルズ」と呼ばれるニュース速報のためにセマフォーとAI契約を結ぶ。
item.description:
Financial Times:
Microsoft strikes an AI deal with Semafor for a breaking news feed called Signals; Ben Smith says it will be written by journalists, using AI as a research tool  —  $1 for 4 weeks  —  Then $75 per month.  Complete digital access to quality FT journalism.  Cancel anytime during your trial.

item.title: CondéNastはいかにしてPitchforkを買収し、そのクリエイティブ・チームを吸収し、プログラマティック広告販売の視聴者主導の条件に適合させようとしたのか（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
How Condé Nast bought and destroyed Pitchfork by absorbing its creative teams and trying to fit it into the audience-driven terms of programmatic ad sales  —  The News  —  In 2015, Condé Nast was nearing a deal to buy the music site Pitchfork, its first major editorial acquisition in years.

item.title: BBC、ITV、Channel 4、パラマウント・グローバルのChannel 5のジョイントベンチャーであるEveryone TVが、2024年第2四半期に開始する新しい無料ストリーミングサービスFreelyを発表（Georg Szalai/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Georg Szalai / The Hollywood Reporter:
Everyone TV, a joint venture of the BBC, ITV, Channel 4 and Paramount Global's Channel 5, announces Freely, a new free streaming service launching in Q2 2024  —  With more than half of U.K. homes expecting to watch TV exclusively via broadband by 2030, it “will bring live and on-demand content together …

item.title: UMGのTikTok撤退、低報酬やディープフェイク対策に関する保証の欠如などの問題に端を発し、音楽業界におけるTikTokの役割（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
A look at UMG's TikTok retreat, stemming from issues like low payouts and a lack of assurances on fighting deepfakes, and TikTok's role in the music industry  —  We're about to find out how important TikTok is to the music industry.  —  Happy Grammy Sunday to those of you who celebrate.

item.title: Skydanceとシャリー・レッドストーンのNational Amusementsの取引の可能性について。
item.description:
Financial Times:
A look at the potential deal between Skydance and Shari Redstone's National Amusements, as a tough media industry landscape forces Redstone to consider offers  —  Interest from Skydance and other bidders could split shareholders in studio behind ‘The Godfather’

item.title: 情報筋によれば、CNNのガザ報道に対する社内の不満と、パレスチナの視点よりもイスラエルの主張を優先する編集方針への不満が述べられている（Chris McGreal/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Chris McGreal / The Guardian:
Sources describe internal discontent about CNN's Gaza coverage and complaints about editorial policies preferring Israeli claims over Palestinian perspectives  —  Insiders say pressure from the top results in credulous reporting of Israeli claims and silencing of Palestinian perspectives

item.title: 加入者数1412万人、コムキャストを抜いて米国最大のケーブルテレビ・プロバイダーとなったチャーターの躍進ぶりを見て、ケーブルテレビの悲惨な現状を浮き彫りにする（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
A look at Charter's rise to become the biggest US cable TV provider, with 14.12M subscribers, topping Comcast and highlighting the dire state of cable TV  —  Charter tops Comcast as No. 1 pay-TV provider by subscribers, months after hinting it may exit the business

item.title: クリエイター・エコノミーは、作家やアーティストにパーソナル・ブランドを構築し、インフルエンサーになることを強要し、多くのアーティストを不快にさせ、売り物のように感じさせている（Rebecca Jennings/Vox）
item.description:
Rebecca Jennings / Vox:
How the creator economy is forcing writers and artists to build personal brands and become influencers, making many artists uncomfortable and feel like sellouts  —  So you want to be an artist.  Do you have to start a TikTok?  —  When Rachael Kay Albers was shopping around her book proposal …

item.title: TechCrunchの広告収入とイベント収入を補完するために立ち上げられたTechCrunch+と、ビジネス記者の発掘問題による失敗について、TechCrunch+の創設編集者（Danny Crichton/Securities）。
item.description:
Danny Crichton / Securities:
TechCrunch+'s founding editor about its launch to complement TechCrunch's ads and events revenue and its failure due to issues with finding business reporters  —  January was a brutal month for journalists, globally from death and locally from layoffs.  The latter hit home this week …

item.title: ギニアにおけるメディア状況の悪化：政府はメディアを遮断・停止し、ジャーナリストを逮捕している（ジャーナリスト保護委員会）
item.description:
Committee to Protect Journalists:
A look at the deteriorating situation for media in Guinea, where the government has been blocking or suspending outlets and arresting journalists  —  Guinean authorities should immediately reverse the suspension of Dépêche Guinée and the privately owned news website's publishing director …

item.title: CBSニュースは、バイデン大統領がCBSのスーパーボウル試合前インタビューに応じないことを確認。
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
CBS News confirms that President Biden will not do a pre-game Super Bowl interview with CBS, the second year in a row that he has turned down the opportunity  —  An interview with the U.S. President in the hours before the Super Bowl has become a tradition in recent decades.

item.title: アゼルバイジャンは臨時選挙に向けた独立メディアの取り締まりを非難されている。アブザス・メディアを含む13人のジャーナリストが拘束された（David Pegg/The Guardian）。
item.description:
David Pegg / The Guardian:
Azerbaijan is accused of cracking down on independent media in the run-up to snap elections; 13 journalists, including from Abzas Media, have been detained  —  Sevinc Vaqifgizi is one of 13 independent journalists detained since snap presidential vote announced

item.title: Apple Vision Pro、このデバイスがスタジオの制作パイプラインをどのように変えるのか、デバイスの将来計画などについて、ディズニーの幹部にインタビュー（Harry McCracken/Fast Company）
item.description:
Harry McCracken / Fast Company:
Interviews with Disney executives about Apple Vision Pro, how the device is changing the studio's production pipelines, future plans for the device, and more  —  Years in the works, the new Disney+ app has an immersive new twist.  But the company sees it as one small step into a new entertainment medium with rich possibilities.

item.title: HBOは、ウクライナが戦争以来ロシアを支持していると非難した後、「The White Lotus」のキャストからミロ&スカロン;ビコビをカットした。
item.description:
Selome Hailu / Variety:
HBO cuts Miloš Biković from The White Lotus cast, after Ukraine accused him of supporting Russia since its war; Biković calls the move a “disturbing precedent”  —  HBO has cut Miloš Biković from the cast of “The White Lotus” Season 3 following a callout …

item.title: 自殺幇助を求めた女性を取材中、ボストン・グローブ紙のコラムニストが自殺幇助の書類に署名し、ジャーナリズムの倫理に疑問を呈した（Tom Jones/Poynter）
item.description:
Tom Jones / Poynter:
While reporting on a woman who sought assisted suicide, a Boston Globe columnist signed a form helping her to proceed, raising questions about journalism ethics  —  While reporting on a woman who sought assisted suicide, Kevin Cullen got personally involved, putting the Globe in an ethical dilemma.
